CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 10, 1945, pg. 14, reads: "Happy Birthday - Little Melvin Ellis of 319 Burrows Street celebrated his fifth birthday last Monday. His is shown with his cousin Bobbie, who helped him celebrate.  Twenty-three other children were present at the party.  Melvin and Bobbie are the great-great-grandsons of Mrs. Belle Singleton, a devout member of Central Baptist Church.  The children's fathers are in armed services. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of eight girls, and six boys, including Melvin Ellis in center wearing striped shirt, suspenders, and dark tie, and Bobbie, posed behind table with birthday cake, in kitchen with polka dot curtains, gingham panel on wall, and tin of "New Era scientific process potato chips" on counter, 319 Burrows Street, Hill District
